info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:53AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cameron and western Calcasieu Parishes, Jefferson, southwestern Newton, southeastern Hardin, Orange and southeastern Jasper Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 452 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Starks to near Forest Heights to near Vidor to near China to near Winnie. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beaumont, Lake Charles, Port Arthur, Sulphur, Orange, Nederland, Groves, Port Neches, Lumberton, Vidor, Bridge City, Cameron, West Orange, Vinton, Sour Lake, Nome, Evadale, Sabine Pass, Johnsons Bayou and Grand Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 880 and 832. Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
